comments:
I'm testing an existing tool-chain with CDT 4.0.0 RC3. So I installed Eclipse 3.3, then CDT 4.0.0 RC3, I then restarted Eclipse and finally installed the plugin defining the tool-chain. My workspace contains some existing projects generated for that tool-chain with CDT 3.1.2. I go to Properties, the configuration is named "convertedConfig" so some kinds of automatic conversion did occur, but the configuration is empty (ie all fields are empty, all check-boxes unchecked, ...). If I click "Manage configurations" I get an assertion (cf below). I also get NPEs when selecting other GUI components (eg "Use default build command"). Apparently the underlying model is invalid/empty. Could this be due to the fact that the projects were somehow converted while the associated tool-chain plugin wasn't installed yet ...

BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

I guess this is the project conversion problem, although I can not reproduce it for the old 3.x gnu tool-chain projects.

Could you attach a sample 3.x project you're trying to convert?

Thanks,
Mikhail

Created an attachment (id=71324)
test project (test.zip)

I can reproduce the problem with the following scenario:

config 1 : eclipse 3.2.2 + cdt 3.1.2 + plug-in defining a proprietary tool-chain 
config 2 : eclipse 3.3.0 + cdt 4.0.0 RC3 (_without_ the plug-in defining the tool-chain)

1) With config 1 I create a new Managed Make C project for our tool-chain (cf attached zip)
2) I close config 1 and open config 2 on the same workspace. The project converter seems to be triggered automatically and a first exception is thrown (note that I don't see the dialog asking me if I really want to migrate the project):

Ignored reentrant call while viewer is busy. This is only logged once per viewer instance, but similar calls will still be ignored.

Then if I select Properties > C/C++ build > Manage Configurations I get the exception previously reported.

What about not converting a project whose tool-chain definition isn't present ?

(In reply to comment #2)
You are right, we should do no conversion in case the tool-chain is not installed.
Currently the converter sielently fails internally and does not propagate any errors to the core. A result we are getting corrupted project.

I'll fix this ASAP.

Thanks,
Mikhail

I've checked in a fix for this: the project conversion is not performed now in case there is no tool-chain installed.
I guess one additional thing needed for this bug is to make the proper message to be displayed for the case the conversion is failed.
I'll fix this and then close the bug.

Mikhail

(In reply to comment #4)
Done. Please verify and re-open in case there's something else needed to be done about this.
